--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Matt Ittigson
<cydatamatt@g...> wrote:
> On 9/6/05, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> > Matt Ittigson wrote:
...
> I just re-ran the job and noticed that my "rejecthops" rule is not
> working correctly.  While it is PASS'ing on some URL's that were not
> part of the original file (incorrect), it is REJECT'ing others
> (correct).  The only reason I can think that it should be PASS'ing
> some (besides a bug in either my configuration or Heritrix) is because
> of a redirection which might be considered analogous to the original
> url passed in through importUris.  Does that make sense?
> 
If your 'rejecthops' is an instance of 'TooManyHopsDecideRule', and
assuming default setting is PASS, then should only be PASS'ing items
if hops path is null -- I don't think the hops path is ever null;
seeds have empty string for hop path -- or if hops path length is <
"max-hops" setting.

Here's the pertinent src:

http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/deciderules/TooManyHopsDecideRule.html#71


> What's the PrerequisiteAcceptRule do?  My TooManyHopsDecideRule is set
> at 1.  Should it be set at 0?

PrerequisiteAcceptRule lets through robots and dns.  You need it.

Try setting your hops to zero.  Looks like it should just let seeds
through.

St.Ack


> 
> Thanks for your continued help.
> 
> -matt
